customData.content: 54-year-old female with a 6-month history of a painless abdominal mass, gradually increasing in size. Appendectomy 8 years ago and a caesarean section 15 years ago. Patient does not smoke, and her family history was negative for malignancy. Patient is a lifelong teacher in secondary school and has lived in one area for a lifetime, with no asbestos-related facility.

HPI.summary: 54-year-old female with a 6-month history of a painless abdominal mass, gradually increasing in size.

social_history.description: lived in one area for a lifetime, with no asbestos-related facility

customData.content: On admission, patient in good health, stable vital signs. Palpable, movable, painless intracavitary mass on the right side of the abdomen; no ascites. White blood cell count 13,100/mm3 (neutrophils 70.2%, lymphocytes 39.6%), hemoglobin 12.4 g/dl, platelets 200,000/mm3. Creatinine 10 mg/l, urea 0.11 g/l, CRP < 6 mg/dl. Abdominal CT scan inconclusive.

HPI.summary: Palpable, movable, painless intracavitary mass on the right side of the abdomen; no ascites.

customData.content: Exploratory laparotomy revealed a localized, encapsulated, firm mesenteric tissue mass, weighing ~500 grams and measuring 12.5 x 10.5 x 8 cm, with no inflammation, mesenteric lymph nodes, or ascites.

imaging.finding: localized, encapsulated, firm mesenteric tissue mass
imaging.impression: localized, encapsulated, firm mesenteric tissue mass

customData.content: Microscopic examination of the tumor showed moderately polymorphic spindle-shaped neoplastic cells with elongated, moderately pleomorphic hyperchromatic nuclei, low mitotic activity, and infiltration of connective tissue. Histopathological features consistent with low-grade sarcomatoid malignant mesothelioma.

imaging.finding: Moderately polymorphic spindle-shaped neoplastic cells with elongated, moderately pleomorphic hyperchromatic nuclei, low mitotic activity, and infiltration of connective tissue.
imaging.impression: Histopathological features consistent with low-grade sarcomatoid malignant mesothelioma.

customData.content: Neoplastic cells positive for keratin AE1/AE3 and CAM 5.2, and negative for desmin and CD34. Immunohistopathological findings consistent with sarcomatoid mesothelioma. Patient referred to oncologist for adjuvant chemotherapy.

data.content: Patient presents with a palpable abdominal mass. Initial lab work and imaging are inconclusive.
Exploratory laparotomy performed due to inconclusive CT scan results.
Histopathological examination of the mass reveals features consistent with low-grade sarcomatoid malignant mesothelioma.
Immunohistopathological findings confirm sarcomatoid mesothelioma diagnosis. Patient referred to oncologist for adjuvant chemotherapy.
